senses.de: The amount of time that something lasts.
senses.ex: The duration of the movie is two hours.

Tips.title: Context Matters
Tips.description: The meaning of 'duration' can change slightly based on context, referring to entertainment, events, or experiences.
Tips.example: The average duration of a concert is about two hours.

Tips.title: Adjective Form
Tips.description: 'Duration' is often preceded by descriptive adjectives like 'long', 'brief', 'average', indicating the length.
Tips.example: They enjoyed a brief duration of peace before the storm.

senses.de: The time during which something continues.
senses.ex: His prison sentence is for a duration of five years.

Tips.title: Legal Time Span
Tips.description: In a legal context, 'duration' usually refers to the time assigned for punishments or contractual terms.
Tips.example: The duration of the non-disclosure agreement is 10 years.

Tips.title: Fixed vs Variable
Tips.description: In legal contexts, 'duration' can be set (fixed) or changeable (variable), impacting rights or penalties.
Tips.example: The duration of his parole is variable, based on behavior.

senses.de: The continuity in time of an object or process.
senses.ex: In physics, we study the duration of various processes.

Tips.title: Duration Intuition
Tips.description: In physics, the concept of duration can be intuitive, like the time it takes for a ball to drop.
Tips.example: Measure the duration of the pendulum's swing.

Tips.title: Duration vs Instant
Tips.description: Unlike an instant, duration implies a process or event with a distinguishable time length.
Tips.example: The laser's pulse had a duration of milliseconds.

senses.de: A measure of the sensitivity of the price of a bond or other debt instrument to a change in interest rates.
senses.ex: Longer duration bonds are usually riskier than shorter duration bonds.

Tips.title: Investment Timeframe
Tips.description: In finance, 'duration' helps investors understand how long their money will be tied up in an investment.
Tips.example: The bond's duration influences its interest rate risks.

Tips.title: Interest Rate Impact
Tips.description: Bond 'duration' affects how sensitive the investment is to the changes in interest rates.
Tips.example: An increase in interest rates affected the bond's duration.

Continuation.wordDefinition:
Continuation refers to the action or process of carrying on something that has already started or been happening before, such as a story, activity, or process.

For example, if you say "the continuation of the story", it means that you want to continue or pick up where the story left off.

So, while continuation refers to the ongoing action or process, duration refers to the length of time that it takes.

Endurance.wordDefinition:
Endurance refers to the ability to withstand or persevere through a difficult or challenging situation. For example, a marathon runner needs to have endurance to be able to complete the race.

Duration is about time, while endurance is about resilience.

Length.wordDefinition:
Duration and length are two different ways of measuring time or space.

Length refers to the size of something in terms of distance or space. For example, the length of a piece of string is how far it extends from one end to the other.

Another example would be the length of a car, which is how much space it takes up on the road.

Duration is used when talking about time and measuring how long something lasts, while length is used when talking about physical size or distance.

Period.wordDefinition:
Period refers to a general length of time that is usually specified. It focuses on a range of time or a specific date range.

Period is typically used when discussing time in relation to a cycle or trend.

For example, the duration of a movie would refer to the time it takes to watch the entire movie from beginning to end. The period of a movie franchise would refer to the length of time the movies have been in production or released.

Duration is more specific and focused on a single, discrete event, while period is more general and focused on a longer time frame or trend.

Persistence.wordDefinition:
Persistence refers to the act of continuing to do something even when faced with difficulties or obstacles. It is applicable in situations where we want to describe someone's determination or perseverance in pursuing a goal.

For example, a person who persists in studying even though it is challenging is said to have persistence.

Span.wordDefinition:
Span refers to the length of time that something covers or encompasses.

It can describe a range or period of time, such as the span of someone's career or the span of a historical event.

Duration describes a specific length of time for a particular event, while span describes the overall length of time something takes place or covers.

Tenure.wordDefinition:
Tenure generally refers to the length of time that someone holds a position or role, such as a professor's tenure at a university or an employee's tenure at a company.

Duration refers more generally to the length of time that something lasts, while tenure refers specifically to the length of time someone holds a position or role.

Term.wordDefinition:
Duration refers to the length of time something lasts or continues for, while term is a specific period of time that is assigned to something.

For example, if you were talking about a movie, the duration would be the length of time the movie runs for (e.g. 2 hours), while the term would be when the movie is released and available to watch (e.g.

it's in theaters for a limited term of 4 weeks).

In simpler terms, duration is the length of time something goes on for, while term is a specific period of time that something is scheduled to happen or exist for.

quotes.Text: Many people suffer at the hands of others. The world can be unfair, at times mercilessly so. Millions of people in the world are genuine victims, right now. All of us will be at some point, whether it's for small matters or large, for a long duration or short. But we aren't all victims, not all the time anyway, not for everything.
quotes.Title: American Theologian
quotes.Name: Kevin DeYoung

quotes.Text: Fortunes are made, and disappear, over the lifetime of a single generation. Today, a person in essence takes his wealth from society just for the duration of his or her lifetime. The next generation has to create it anew.
quotes.Title: Russian Businessman
quotes.Name: Mikhail Khodorkovsky

quotes.Text: When you are thinking about going away for a long duration mission, it has to be part of your mindset that you're leaving your family, but it's for the right reasons, for good reasons, and hopefully helping humanity.
quotes.Title: American Astronaut
quotes.Name: Sunita Williams

quotes.Text: To play these twisted, tormented characters is very draining. You have to sit in the pocket of that character for the duration of the shoot, which is normally an average of three months, and that can be taxing!
quotes.Title: British Actor
quotes.Name: Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje

quotes.Text: Death is not an event in life: we do not live to experience death. If we take eternity to mean not infinite temporal duration but timelessness, then eternal life belongs to those who live in the present.
quotes.Title: Austrian Philosopher
quotes.Name: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.Text: Insurance and funding traditionally drive capital investment. But in a world based on access, not ownership, the duration, value, cost and extent of financial services is distinctly different.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Lisa Gansky

quotes.Text: The value of life is not in its duration, but in its donation. You are not important because of how long you live, you are important because of how effective you live.
quotes.Title: Bahamian Clergyman
quotes.Name: Myles Munroe

quotes.Text: Through a huge duration of my life, someone has always picked up after me. And when you're on your own and you're trying to be independent, it's definitely different.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Jessica Simpson

quotes.Text: The only control we have over the duration of our life is to shorten it, and we do that all the time.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: S. Jay Olshansky

quotes.Text: The measure of life is not its duration, but its donation.
quotes.Title: Scottish Clergyman
quotes.Name: Peter Marshall
